page.title: 06Langore
page.content: Langore is a small village about 3 miles from Launceston.It is the largest complete settlement in our rectangle.As you approach it you can see that Langore is positioned on a hill with houses and fields on both sides of the road.The village is kept clean, tidy and attractive.It is said that the village got its name because it was originally called "Longmoor"as the land on the south side of the village was open moor or downland.This name was then shortened to"Longore" and eventually became Langore.The first thing you notice when going down the hill into the village is a village green.It is now being landscaped and cleared of the trees to make a playing area for the children. Climbing apparatus is to be built and an area has been covered in tarmac so children can play games.
